API Reference¶

BaseApp¶

class flask.ext.appbuilder.baseapp.BaseApp(app, db, menu=None, indexview=None, static_folder='static/appbuilder', static_url_path='/appbuilder')¶

This is the base class for the all framework. Will hold your flask app object, all your views, and security classes.

initialize your application like this:

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config.from_object('config')
db = SQLAlchemy(app)
baseapp = BaseApp(app, db)
add_link(name, href, icon='', category='', baseview=None)¶

Add your own links to menu using this method

Parameters:
  • name – The string name that will be displayed on the menu.
  • href – Override the generated href for the menu.
  • icon – Bootstrap included icon name
  • category – The menu category where the menu will be included
add_separator(category)¶

Add a separator to the menu, you will sequentially create the menu

Parameters:category – The menu category where the separator will be included.
add_view(baseview, name, href='', icon='', category='')¶

Add your views associated with menus using this method.

Parameters:
  • baseview – A BaseView type class instantiated.
  • name – The string name that will be displayed on the menu.
  • href – Override the generated href for the menu.
  • icon – Bootstrap included icon name
  • category – The menu category where the menu will be included
add_view_no_menu(baseview, endpoint=None, static_folder=None)¶

Add your views without creating a menu.

Parameters:baseview – A BaseView type class instantiated.

Views¶

flask.ext.appbuilder.views.expose(url='/', methods=('GET', ))¶

Use this decorator to expose views in your view classes.

Parameters:
  • url – Relative URL for the view
  • methods – Allowed HTTP methods. By default only GET is allowed.
class flask.ext.appbuilder.views.BaseView¶

All views inherit from this class. it’s constructor will register your exposed urls on flask as a Blueprint.

This class does not expose any urls, but provides a common base for all views.

Extend this class if you want to expose methods for your own templates

create_blueprint(baseapp, endpoint=None, static_folder=None)¶

Create Flask blueprint. You will generally not use it

Parameters:
  • baseapp – the BaseApp application
  • endpoint – endpoint override for this blueprint, will assume class name if not provided
  • static_folder – the relative override for static folder, if ommited application will use the baseapp static
route_base = None¶

Override this if you want to define your own relative url

class flask.ext.appbuilder.views.IndexView¶

A simple view that implements the index for the site

class flask.ext.appbuilder.views.SimpleFormView¶

View for presenting your own forms Inherit from this view to provide some base processing for your customized form views.

Notice that this class inherits from BaseView so all properties from the parent class can be overridden also.

Implement form_get and form_post to implement your form pre-processing and post-processing

form = None¶

The WTF form to render

form_columns = None¶

The form columns to include, if empty will include all

form_get(form)¶

Override this method to implement your form processing

form_post(form)¶

Override this method to implement your form processing

form_title = ''¶

The form title to be displayed

class flask.ext.appbuilder.views.BaseModelView(**kwargs)¶

The base class of GeneralView and ChartView, all properties are inherited Customize GeneralView and ChartView overriding this properties

base_filters = None¶

Filter the view use: [‘column_name’,BaseFilter,’value’]

example:

def get_user():
    return g.user

class MyView(GeneralView):
    datamodel = SQLAModel(MyTable, db.session)
    base_filters = [['created_by', FilterEqualFunction, get_user],
                    ['name', FilterStartsWith, 'a']]
datamodel = None¶

Your sqla model you must initialize it like datamodel = SQLAModel(Permission, session)

label_columns = None¶

Dictionary of labels for your columns, override this if you want diferent pretify labels

example (will just override the label for name column):

class MyView(GeneralView):
    datamodel = SQLAModel(MyTable, db.session)
    label_columns = {'name':'My Name Label Overrride'}
search_columns = None¶

List with allowed search columns, if not provided all possible search columns will be used

search_form = None¶

To implement your own add WTF form for Search

class flask.ext.appbuilder.views.BaseCRUDView(**kwargs)¶

The base class of GeneralView, all properties are inherited Customize GeneralView overriding this properties

add_columns = None¶

Include Columns for add view

add_fieldsets = None¶

add fieldsets django style (look at show_fieldsets for an example)

add_form = None¶

To implement your own add WTF form for Add

add_form_extra_fields = None¶

Dictionary to add extra fields to the Add form using this property

add_template = 'appbuilder/general/model/add.html'¶

Your own add jinja2 template for add

add_title = ''¶

Add Title

add_widget¶

Add widget override

alias of FormWidget

Dictionary with column descriptions that will be shown on the forms

edit_columns = None¶

Include Columns for edit view

edit_fieldsets = None¶

edit fieldsets django style (look at show_fieldsets for an example)

edit_form = None¶

To implement your own add WTF form for Edit

edit_form_extra_fields = None¶

Dictionary to Add extra fields to the Edit form using this property

edit_template = 'appbuilder/general/model/edit.html'¶

Your own add jinja2 template for edit

edit_title = ''¶

Edit Title

edit_widget¶

Edit widget override

alias of FormWidget

Include Columns for lists view

list_template = 'appbuilder/general/model/list.html'¶

Your own add jinja2 template for list

List Title

list_widget¶

List widget override

alias of ListWidget

Allowed order columns

page_size = 10¶

Page size

post_add(item)¶

Override this, will be called after update

post_delete(item)¶

Override this, will be called after delete

post_update(item)¶

Override this, will be called after update

pre_add(item)¶

Override this, will be called before add

pre_delete(item)¶

Override this, will be called before delete

pre_update(item)¶

Override this, will be called before update

related_views = None¶

List with instantiated GeneralView classes That will be displayed related with this one using relationship sqlalchemy property

search_widget¶

Search widget you can override with your own

alias of SearchWidget

show_columns = None¶

Include Columns for show view

show_fieldsets = None¶

show fieldsets django style [(<’TITLE’|None>, {‘fields’:[<F1>,<F2>,...]}),....]

class MyView(GeneralView):
    datamodel = SQLAModel(MyTable, db.session)

    show_fieldsets = [
        ('Summary',{'fields':['name','address','group']}),
        ('Personal Info',{'fields':['birthday','personal_phone'],'expanded':False}),
        ]
show_template = 'appbuilder/general/model/show.html'¶

Your own add jinja2 template for show

show_title = ''¶

Show Title

show_widget¶

Show widget override

alias of ShowWidget

validators_columns = None¶

Dictionary to add your own validators for forms

class flask.ext.appbuilder.views.GeneralView(**kwargs)¶

This is the CRUD generic view. If you want to automatically implement create, edit, delete, show, and search form your database tables, inherit your views from this class.

Notice that this class inherits from BaseCRUDView so all properties from the parent class can be overrided also.

Chart Views¶

class flask.ext.appbuilder.charts.views.BaseChartView(**kwargs)¶

This is the base class for all chart views. Use ChartView or TimeChartView, override their properties and these to customise your charts

chart_3d = 'true'¶

Will display in 3D?

chart_template = 'appbuilder/general/charts/chart.html'¶

The chart template, override to implement your own

chart_title = 'Chart'¶

A title to be displayed on the chart

chart_type = 'PieChart'¶

The chart type PieChart or ColumnChart

chart_widget¶

Chart widget override to implement your own

alias of ChartWidget

group_by_columns = []¶

A list of columns to be possibly grouped by

search_widget¶

Search widget override to implement your own

alias of SearchWidget

width = 400¶

The width

class flask.ext.appbuilder.charts.views.ChartView(**kwargs)¶

Provides a simple (and hopefully nice) way to draw charts on your application.

This will show Google Charts based on group by of your tables.

class flask.ext.appbuilder.charts.views.TimeChartView(**kwargs)¶

Provides a simple way to draw some time charts on your application.

This will show Google Charts based on count and group by month and year for your tables.

Mixins¶

class flask.ext.appbuilder.models.mixins.BaseMixin¶

Use this class has a mixin for your models, it will define your tablenames automatically MyModel will be called my_model on the database.

from sqlalchemy import Table, Column, Integer, String, Boolean, ForeignKey, Date
from flask.ext.appbuilder import Base

class MyModel(BaseMixin, Base):
    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True)
    name = Column(String(50), unique = True, nullable=False)
class flask.ext.appbuilder.models.mixins.AuditMixin¶

AuditMixin Mixin for models, adds 4 columns to stamp, time and user on creation and modification will create the following columns:

class flask.ext.appbuilder.models.mixins.FileColumn(*args, **kwargs)¶
